bug.author: romibuzi
bug.description:
Hi all, I don't know if it's a wanted change but I've tried the latest release (beta3) on a old distribution (CentOS 6) and it doesn't seem to handle GLIBC prior to version 2.14. I didn't have the problem with beta2. <denchmark-h:h1>Version Information</denchmark-h>
Deeplearning4j : version 1.0.0-beta3 ND4J driver : native (CPU) Platform information : <denchmark-code>$ lsb_release --all LSB Version: :base-4.0-amd64:base-4.0-noarch:core-4.0-amd64:core-4.0-noarch:graphics-4.0-amd64:graphics-4.0-noarch:printing-4.0-amd64:printing-4.0-noarch Distributor ID: CentOS Description: CentOS release 6.9 (Final) Release: 6.9 Codename: Final
$ ldd --version ldd (GNU libc) 2.12 Copyright (C) 2010 Free Software Foundation, Inc. This is free software; see the source for copying conditions. There is NO warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. Written by Roland McGrath and Ulrich Drepper. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Code</denchmark-h>
package org.romibuzi.dl4jtests.main
import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession import org.deeplearning4j.util.ModelSerializer import org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray import org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j import com.google.common.io.Resources
object PredictMain { def main(args: Array[String]): Unit = { implicit val sparkSession: SparkSession = SparkSession .builder() .appName("SparkSession for tests") .master("local[*]") .getOrCreate()
val modelPath = Resources.getResource("model.zip").getPath val model = ModelSerializer.restoreComputationGraph(modelPath)
val input: RDD[FeaturesRow] = sparkSession.sparkContext.parallelize(Seq( FeaturesRow(day= "2018-01-01", features = Nd4j.ones(1, 2, 1)), FeaturesRow(day= "2018-01-02", features = Nd4j.ones(2, 2, 1)), FeaturesRow(day= "2018-01-03", features = Nd4j.ones(3, 2, 1)) ))
// Predicting val results = input.map { x => model.output(x.features)(0).toFloatVector }
results.foreach(println) } }
case class FeaturesRow(day: String, features: INDArray) <denchmark-h:h1>Stack Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>*** RUN ABORTED *** java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: at org.nd4j.linalg.cpu.nativecpu.ops.NativeOpExecutioner.<init>(NativeOpExecutioner.java:71) at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:408) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:438) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initWithBackend(Nd4j.java:5587) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initContext(Nd4j.java:5482) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.<clinit>(Nd4j.java:215) at sncf.ouit.adwords.clickcostpredictions.predictions.Predict$.scaleBids(Predict.scala:97) ... Cause: java.lang.RuntimeException: ND4J is probably missing dependencies. For more information, please refer to: http://nd4j.org/getstarted.html at org.nd4j.nativeblas.NativeOpsHolder.<init>(NativeOpsHolder.java:68) at org.nd4j.nativeblas.NativeOpsHolder.<clinit>(NativeOpsHolder.java:36) at org.nd4j.linalg.cpu.nativecpu.ops.NativeOpExecutioner.<init>(NativeOpExecutioner.java:71) at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:408) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:438) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initWithBackend(Nd4j.java:5587) at org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4j.initContext(Nd4j.java:5482) ... Cause: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no jnind4jcpu in java.library.path at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1865) at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:870) at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:1119) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.loadLibrary(Loader.java:1258) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:999) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:891) at org.nd4j.nativeblas.Nd4jCpu.<clinit>(Nd4jCpu.java:10) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:344) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:950) ... Cause: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/romain/.javacpp/cache/nd4j-native-1.0.0-beta3-linux-x86_64.jar/org/nd4j/nativeblas/linux-x86_64/libjnind4jcpu.so: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /home/romain/.javacpp/cache/nd4j-native-1.0.0-beta3-linux-x86_64.jar/org/nd4j/nativeblas/linux-x86_64/libjnind4jcpu.so) at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1937) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1822) at java.lang.Runtime.load0(Runtime.java:809) at java.lang.System.load(System.java:1083) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.loadLibrary(Loader.java:1238) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:999) at org.bytedeco.javacpp.Loader.load(Loader.java:891) at org.nd4j.nativeblas.Nd4jCpu.<clinit>(Nd4jCpu.java:10) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) </denchmark-code>
Aha! Link: <denchmark-link:https://skymindai.aha.io/features/ND4J-147>https://skymindai.aha.io/features/ND4J-147</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sshepel>@sshepel</denchmark-link> Looks like something changed with our build environment?
yeap, looks like latest release has been built with centos7 ðŸ˜ž
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/romibuzi>@romibuzi</denchmark-link> could you please check latest snapshots from , they should be built on Centos 6.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhouxinsheng>@zhouxinsheng</denchmark-link> if you demand help again, I will ban you from interacting with this repository :) - please actually read the comments <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sshepel>@sshepel</denchmark-link> said above and try to be more polite. We are not here on your timeline. You are getting code help for free. Do not take that for granted.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xuzhongxing>@xuzhongxing</denchmark-link> please just post what issues you're having you've tried the above. That's all we ask :)

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/agibsonccc>@agibsonccc</denchmark-link> sorry for the "help", i really appreciate your selfless contributions for dl4j users. As to solutions of snapshots, i just can not connect to the oss.nexus, i have tried, always download jar files failed.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xuzhongxing>@xuzhongxing</denchmark-link> Thanks for understanding! I think we have an alicloud proxy. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wangfeng-skymind>@wangfeng-skymind</denchmark-link> ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xuzhongxing>@xuzhongxing</denchmark-link> you can use ali mirror of the maven repo

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wangfeng-skymind>@wangfeng-skymind</denchmark-link> i searched maven.aliyun.com, but did not find snapshot of nd4j and deeplearning4j, could you show me the exact url?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zhouxinsheng>@zhouxinsheng</denchmark-link> plz follow below configuration step, 1ï¼š open your maven path/conf/setting.xml 2ï¼š find the elements <mirrorsï¼š 3ï¼špaste these code
alimaven aliyun maven <denchmark-link:http://maven.aliyun.com/nexus/content/groups/public/>http://maven.aliyun.com/nexus/content/groups/public/</denchmark-link>
central
4ï¼šupdate your mave repo
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sshepel>@sshepel</denchmark-link> I've just tested it with latest snapshot and it worked !
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/romibuzi>@romibuzi</denchmark-link> thanks for your replay!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wangfeng-skymind>@wangfeng-skymind</denchmark-link> I am running into a similar problem. Could you please explain your instructions?

@aakashganga 1:this "<denchmark-link:http://maven.aliyun.com>http://maven.aliyun.com</denchmark-link> " website belongs china company,I am not sure if you can access it abroad. you can use better maven repository, such as: <denchmark-link:https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mvnrepository.com/>https://mvnrepository.com/</denchmark-link> etc 2:because the github ignore some character, such as: " ....", So the grammar seems to have some problemsï¼Œ but it is not the case, for the configuration setting.xml,you can refer the link:<denchmark-link:https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-mirror-settings.html>https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-mirror-settings.html</denchmark-link>
3:somebody recommend you to use 0.9.2-snapshot to solve the problem, you can try it , you can use the pom.xml to replace your pom.xml, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/maxpumperla/dl4j_coursera/blob/master/pom.xml>https://github.com/maxpumperla/dl4j_coursera/blob/master/pom.xml</denchmark-link>

@aakashganga There is even a simpler solution than setup a mirror, just add a extra repository in your pom.xml like that : <repositories> <repository> <id>sonatype-snapshots</id> <name>sonatype-snapshots</name> <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/</url> <layout>default</layout> </repository> </repositories> Then you will be able to use snapshots, currently the latest available is 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/romibuzi>@romibuzi</denchmark-link> . I keep on getting this error while doing mvn clean install. [ERROR] Plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-clean-plugin:2.5 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-clean-plugin:jar:2.5 in maven-public (<denchmark-link:https://mvnrepository.com/>https://mvnrepository.com/</denchmark-link> )
@aakashganga What is the output when you run this command ? mvn -X clean install

You are using <denchmark-link:https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/</denchmark-link> as a mirror for central, as this line is saying :
sonatype snapshots should not be used as a mirror of the central, but as a complement for snapshots instead. Leave you mirror config blank inside ~/.m2/settings.xml but just add sonatype as an extra repository in your pom.xml, as I've posted above

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/romibuzi>@romibuzi</denchmark-link> I did what you suggested, but, it gives me the same error I was getting before putting the mirror Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: ~/.javacpp/cache/dl4j-keras-runner-0.1-jar-with-dependencies.jar/org/nd4j/nativeblas/linux-x86_64/libjnind4jcpu.so: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by ~/.javacpp/cache/dl4j-keras-runner-0.1-jar-with-dependencies.jar/org/nd4j/nativeblas/linux-x86_64/libjnind4jcpu.so)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/files/2622282/pom.txt>pom.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexDBlack>@AlexDBlack</denchmark-link> See above. The issue is with GLIBC_2.14 not found.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexDBlack>@AlexDBlack</denchmark-link> got it. I will make the change and report the outcome.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexDBlack>@AlexDBlack</denchmark-link> made the changes. Now get this error Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/bytedeco/javacpp/openblas_nolapack.
@aakashganga Remove anything related to JavaCPP, using old versions of that won't work.

okay <denchmark-link:https://github.com/saudet>@saudet</denchmark-link> .. did that. Now get this. Looks like there is already a thread on this. Do I need to make any changes to pom.xml? Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: Kryo serialization detected without an appropriate registrator for ND4J INDArrays. When using Kryo, An appropriate Kryo registrator must be used to avoid serialization issues (NullPointerException) with off-heap data in INDArrays. Use nd4j-kryo_2.10 or _2.11 artifact, with sparkConf.set("spark.kryo.registrator", "org.nd4j.Nd4jRegistrator"); I am trying to run a jar through spark-submit. How may I do the above?

@aakashganga You've already posted about this, and have already been given a response: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/issues/6761#issuecomment-441480593>https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/issues/6761#issuecomment-441480593</denchmark-link>
The error itself is completely unrelated to this glibc issue, and it includes exactly how to fix it. Please read the error and follow the steps it suggests before asking for help. If that's not enough, read this: <denchmark-link:https://deeplearning4j.org/docs/latest/deeplearning4j-scaleout-howto#kryo>https://deeplearning4j.org/docs/latest/deeplearning4j-scaleout-howto#kryo</denchmark-link>

For anyone interested. This is how you dynamically set Sparkconf parameter as a part of the spark-submit spark2-submit --class skymind.dsx.KerasImportCSVSparkRunner --conf spark.executor.cores=8 --conf spark.kryo.registrator=org.nd4j.Nd4jRegistrator --conf spark.serializer=org.apache.spark.serializer.KryoSerializer --files iris.txt,model.h5 --master yarn target/dl4j-keras-runner-0.1-jar-with-dependencies.jar -batchSizePerWorker 15 -indexLabel 4 -numClasses 3 -modelFileName model.h5 -dataFileName iris.txt

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sshepel>@sshepel</denchmark-link> Ok no problem, I'll stay tuned
